summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The AUDIO_STREAM_CONFIG_CAPS structure describes a range of audio formats. Audio compression and capture filters use this structure to describe the formats they can produce.

member.name: AUDIO_STREAM_CONFIG_CAPS.guid
member.summary: Will be set to MEDIATYPE_Audio to indicate an audio sample.

member.name: AUDIO_STREAM_CONFIG_CAPS.ChannelsGranularity
member.summary: Granularity of the channels. For example, the filter might specify channels 2 through 4, in steps of 2.

member.name: AUDIO_STREAM_CONFIG_CAPS.BitsPerSampleGranularity
member.summary: Granularity of the bits per sample. For example, the filter might specify 8 bits per sample through 32 bits per sample, in steps of 8.

member.name: AUDIO_STREAM_CONFIG_CAPS.SampleFrequencyGranularity
member.summary: Granularity of the frequency. For example, the filter might specify 11025 Hz to 44100 Hz, in steps of 11025 Hz.
